H0.text: when was the minimum wage established in the united states. 1912

H1.text: when was the minimum wage established in the united states. 1920

H2.text: when was the minimum wage established in the united states. 1940

H3.text: when was the minimum wage established in the united states. 1933

A4.text: The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 29 U.S.C. § 203 (FLSA) ... was enacted by the 75th Congress and signed into law by President Franklin D. Roosevelt in 1938.

A5.text: The act increased the minimum wage from 40 cents to 75 cents per hour, effective January 24, 1950.

A6.text: October 24 – The minimum wage is established by law in the U.S.

A7.text: Congress enacted the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938.

A8.text: The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 created a minimum wage (now $7.25 at federal level, higher in 28 states) and overtime pay of one and a half times.

A9.text: The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 requires a federal minimum wage, currently $7.25 but higher in 29 states and D.C., and discourages working weeks over 40 hours through time-and-a-half overtime pay.

A10.text: The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 requires a federal minimum wage, currently $7.25 but higher in 29 states and D.C.
